thread.title: REVEALED: Why TODAY is the best day of the year to put your home on the market
thread.title_full: REVEALED: Why TODAY is the best day of the year to put your home on the market

title: REVEALED: Why TODAY is the best day of the year to put your home on the market
text:
REVEALED: Why TODAY is the best day of the year to put your home on the market REVEALED: Why TODAY is the best day of the year to put your home on the market THE British weather and school admission deadlines are among the reasons why TODAY is the best day to put your home on the property market, according to a new study. PUBLISHED: 14:04, Wed, Sep 2, 2015 | UPDATED: 14:09, Wed, Sep 2, 2015 GETTY September 2 is the best day to put your home on the market according to research 
Listing a home on September 2 gives property owners a prime two-month window to sell their home, before buyer activity tails off at the end of November until the end of the year.Buyers see Christmas as a key influencing factor, with many people determined to be moved in time for December 25, the date helps to push through a sale, found online estate agent eMoov. Securing a home in a desired catchment area before the start of February and school application deadlines is another factor expected to be pushing buyers to seal a deal in the coming weeks. The last few weeks of warmer weather also help to make a property more attractive, with almost a fifth of sellers reporting that it's more difficult to sell a home in winter. Finally buyers who have typically been on holiday or busy with children during the summer months are now back in the market and giving searches their full attention. Related articles REVEALED: The 10 most affordable commuter towns for London 
Founder and chief executive of eMoov.co.uk, Russell Quirk, said: "Listing your property for sale on the 2nd September is certainly going to aid the sale of your home. "September is the second busiest month for buyer activity on Rightmove and Zoopla. Although January tops the table in terms of traffic levels, itâ€™s also one of the peak months for those listing their property so competition is fierce."The analysis also suggested putting a home up for sale in September could even see a higher price achieved, as it's when demand is more likely to outstrip supply.
